title: Indonesian Fried Rice (Nasi Goreng)

ingredients.name: kecap manis (sweet soy sauce)
ingredients.notes: 1 tbsp for chicken, 2 tbsp for rice

ingredients.name: tomatoes and cucumbers
ingredients.notes: optional garnish, cut into wedges or chunks

instructions: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat.
Add chilli and garlic, stir for 10 seconds.
Add onion, cook for 1 minute.
Add chicken and cook until it mostly turns white, then add 1 tbsp kecap manis and cook for a further 1 minute or until chicken is mostly cooked through and slightly caramelised.
Add rice, 2 tbsp kecap manis, and shrimp paste (if using). Cook, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes until the sauce reduces and the rice grains start to caramelise.
Serve garnished with your choice of green onions, red chilli, and fried shallots. Optionally serve with a fried egg sunny side up, tomato wedges, cucumber slices, and lime wedges.

title: Crispy Cheese Smashed Sweet Potato Pancakes + Chilli Fried Egg

ingredients.name: cheddar cheese
ingredients.notes: grated; plant-based or vegan cheese works well as a substitute

ingredients.name: crispy chilli oil
ingredients.notes: such as Lao Gan Ma; chilli crisp also works; pesto can be substituted with a little extra oil for frying

ingredients.name: creme fraiche or yoghurt
ingredients.notes: for garnish; use plant-based alternative for vegan

instructions: Prick the sweet potatoes all over, then microwave on high until tender, around 15-20 minutes.
Smash each potato flat between two sheets of baking paper using a burger press, spatula, or pan.
Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add small rounds of cheese directly to the dry pan, roughly the same size as the smashed potatoes.
Place a smashed sweet potato on top of each cheese round. Cook until the cheese is golden and crispy, then flip and cook until golden and crispy on the other side. Work in batches if needed.

Wipe the pan clean. Heat the chilli oil over medium heat, crack in the eggs, and cook to your liking. Optionally cover with a lid or bowl for 15-20 seconds near the end to set any remaining raw egg white.
To serve, stack the sweet potato pancakes, top with the fried egg, a dollop of creme fraiche or yoghurt, pickled red onions, extra chilli crisp, and sliced chives or spring onion.

title: Korean Beef Bulgogi
instructions: Combine soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, and pear in a bowl
Add sliced beef and marinate for 30 minutes to 2 hours
Heat a large skillet over high heat
Cook beef in batches until browned and cooked through
Serve over rice with kimchi

title: Classic Pasta Carbonara
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil
Cook pasta until al dente
While pasta cooks, crisp guanciale in a large pan
Whisk eggs, cheese, and pepper in a bowl
Toss hot pasta with egg mixture and guanciale
Serve immediately with extra cheese and pepper

title: Overnight Oats with Berry Compote
instructions: Mix oats, almond milk, chia seeds, and 1 tbsp maple syrup
Refrigerate overnight
Simmer berries with remaining maple syrup until soft
Top oats with berry compote and serve
